column2: This movie is the definition of a comfort watch. So charming and sweet.
The final press conference scene where she says 'indefinitely' is the most romantic ending ever.
Hugh Grant is the king of awkward British charm. He's perfect in this.
The way they end up together, with him having to chase her down after the press conference... pure rom-com gold.
Julia Roberts playing a movie star is just perfect casting.
The final shot of them on the park bench, pregnant and happy, is the perfect 'happily ever after'.
Spike is the most hilarious and disgusting roommate in movie history. I love him.
The 'I'm also just a girl, standing in front of a boy, asking him to love her' line is iconic for a reason.
The setting of Notting Hill is so beautiful and romantic. It makes you want to move there.
The way William turns her down at first, because he can't handle the heartbreak again, felt so real.
The scene with the brownie competition at the dinner party is so funny.
The final race to the hotel, with all his friends helping, is a classic rom-com climax.
The chemistry between Hugh Grant and Julia Roberts is off the charts.
Her giving him the original Chagall painting at the end is such a beautiful gesture.
The movie is just pure, unadulterated feel-good romance.
The moment he realizes he made a mistake and has to win her back is what the whole movie builds to.
The supporting cast is fantastic. The friend group is so quirky and lovable.
The way they show the changing seasons as they're apart is a beautiful montage.
The awkwardness of their first meeting in the bookshop is so cute.
The final kiss at the press conference is a perfect fairytale moment.
The film is just so witty and well-written.
The ending proves that even a normal guy and a superstar can find love.
The scene where he has to pretend to be a journalist from 'Horse & Hound' is hilarious.
The way their relationship has so many ups and downs makes the ending so much more satisfying.
The soundtrack is perfect. 'She' by Elvis Costello is forever linked to this movie.
The final scene is just pure, unadulterated happiness.
Spike's t-shirts are a running gag that never gets old.
The moment she shows up at his door after the scandal breaks is a huge turning point.
The movie is just incredibly charming from start to finish.
The ending is a perfect example of a grand romantic gesture that actually works.
The dialogue is so quotable and funny.
The final press conference is the ultimate public declaration of love.
The film captures the feeling of a whirlwind romance perfectly.
The way his friends protect him and her is so sweet.
The movie is a modern classic of the rom-com genre.
The final shot on the bench is the perfect, quiet ending to their story.
The contrast between his humble life and her glamorous one is the core of the story.
The moment he sees her posters all over his friend's house is a funny reminder of who she is.
A perfect date night movie.
The ending is everything you want from a romantic comedy.
The way they keep bumping into each other feels like fate.
The final scene is a beautiful glimpse into their future together.
The humor is so smart and character-driven.
Her speech in the bookshop is the emotional climax of the film.
The movie is just a delight.
The ending is a triumph for hopeless romantics everywhere.
The supporting characters are all so well-drawn.
The way they fall in love feels so natural, despite the crazy circumstances.
The film is a perfect blend of humor and romance.
The final scene is the perfect, heartwarming conclusion.
The script is just so well-crafted.
Her choice to come back for him shows that her love is real.
The movie is a timeless love story.
The ending is the perfect payoff for all the emotional ups and downs.
The charm of the cast is what makes this movie so special.
The final press conference is a scene that will go down in rom-com history.
The film is a beautiful story about two different worlds colliding.
The ending is just so romantic and satisfying.
The humor is so quintessentially British and I love it.
The way he finally stands up for himself and their relationship at the end is great.
A perfect movie to watch when you need a pick-me-up.
The final scene is a beautiful and simple depiction of their happy ending.
The performances are what make the movie work so well.
The press conference is the grand gesture that proves his love for her.
The film is a charming and funny look at love and fame.
The ending is a perfect fairytale conclusion to a modern love story.
The witty banter between the characters is a highlight.
The way they support each other's dreams is so sweet.
A classic rom-com that never gets old.
The final scene is a beautiful and quiet moment of domestic bliss.
The movie is just so incredibly likable.
Her final decision to choose him over her career (in that moment) is a huge deal.
The film has so much heart and soul.
The ending is a perfect example of a truly happy ending.
The humor is so sharp and well-observed.
The way their love story plays out is so romantic and aspirational.
A perfect movie that will always make you smile.
The final scene shows that they really did get their happily ever after.
The writing is just so clever.
Her big speech is the turning point that leads to the happy ending.
The movie is a timeless classic for a reason.
The ending is the perfect, heartwarming conclusion to a beautiful love story.
The cast has such amazing chemistry together.
The press conference scene is the perfect climax for a Hollywood love story.
The film is a beautiful and funny story about love against the odds.
The ending is just pure wish-fulfillment in the best way.
The humor is what makes this movie so rewatchable.
The way he decides to go after her is a great 'now or never' moment.
A charming and heartfelt film.
The final scene is the perfect, quiet happily ever after.
The performances are so charismatic and engaging.
The press conference is the ultimate grand romantic gesture.
The film is a classic love story with a modern twist.
The ending is just so satisfying and makes you feel good.
The witty dialogue is one of the best parts of the movie.
The way they navigate their different worlds is the core of their story.
A timeless rom-com that will always be a favorite.
The final scene on the bench is the perfect, peaceful ending.
